<<<<<<< HEAD
A third dialogue between the Pope and a phanatick, concerning affairs in England by the author of the first and second, who is a hearty lover of his prince and country. Hearty lover of his prince and country. Ferguson, Robert, d. 1714.
[4], 53 p.
Printed by J.P, and are to be sold by William Oliver in Norwich, London : 1684.
Ascribed by Wing to Robert Ferguson. Item at reel 582:16 incorrectly identified as Wing T907. Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
=======
